questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_0^2 x\sqrt{x^2+1}\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi/2} \sin^2 x \cos x\,dx\).
questions.explanation: Let \(u = \sin x\), \(du = \cos x\,dx\). When \(x=0\), \(u=0\); when \(x=\pi/2\), \(u=1\). Integral becomes \(\int_0^1 u^2\,du = \frac{u^3}{3}\big|_0^1 = \frac{1}{3}\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_1^e \frac{\ln x}{x}\,dx\).
questions.explanation: Let \(u = \ln x\), \(du = \frac{1}{x}\,dx\). When \(x=1\), \(u=0\); when \(x=e\), \(u=1\). Integral becomes \(\int_0^1 u\,du = \frac{u^2}{2}\big|_0^1 = \frac{1}{2}\).

questions.question: A particle moves along the x‑axis with velocity \(v(t) = t^2 - 5t + 6\) m/s. On the interval \([0,5]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Set \(v(t)=0\): \((t-2)(t-3)=0\) ⇒ \(t=2,3\). Check signs: \(v(0)=6>0\), \(v(2.5)=-0.25<0\), \(v(5)=6>0\). The particle changes direction at \(t=2\) and \(t=3\), so 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x) = 4x^3\) on the interval \([0,3]\).
Let \(p(x) = x^3 + x - 1\). Which interval is guaranteed by the Intermediate Value Theorem to contain a zero?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(p(0) = -1 < 0\) and \(p(1) = 1+1-1 = 1 > 0\). Since \(p\) is continuous and changes sign on \([0,1]\), there is a zero in this interval. The other intervals have no sign change.

questions.question: Find the general solution to the differential equation \(\frac{dy}{dx} = 2xy^2\).
questions.explanation: Separate variables: \(\frac{dy}{y^2} = 2x\,dx\). Integrate: \(-\frac{1}{y} = x^2 + C\). Solve for \(y\): \(y = \frac{-1}{x^2+C}\).

questions.question: Let \(G(x) = \int_1^{x^3} \sqrt{t+1}\,dt\). Find \(G'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC Part 1 and the chain rule: \(G'(x) = \sqrt{x^3+1} \cdot \frac{d}{dx}(x^3) = 3x^2\sqrt{x^3+1}\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x) = e^{\sin x}\).
questions.explanation: Chain rule: \(\frac{d}{dx}e^{\sin x} = e^{\sin x} \cdot \cos x\).

questions.question: Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x) = \sec(3x)\).
questions.explanation: Using the chain rule: \(\frac{d}{du}\sec u = \sec u\tan u\). With \(u=3x\): \(f'(x) = \sec(3x)\tan(3x)\cdot 3 = 3\sec(3x)\tan(3x)\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x) = \begin{cases} x^2 - 3 & x < 2 \\ 1 & x = 2 \\ 2x - 3 & x > 2 \end{cases}\). Is \(f\) continuous at \(x=2\)? Justify.
options: Yes, because both one-sided limits equal 1 and \(f(2)=1\)
No, because the left and right limits are different
questions.explanation: Left limit: \(2^2-3=1\). Right limit: \(2(2)-3=1\). Both equal 1, and \(f(2)=1\). Since the two-sided limit exists and equals \(f(2)\), the function is continuous at \(x=2\).

questions.question: Find all x‑values where \(f(x) = 2x^3 - 9x^2 + 12x - 1\) has a point of inflection.
Use implicit differentiation to find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) for \(x^2 y + y^2 = 3x\).
questions.explanation: Differentiate: \(2xy + x^2 y' + 2y\, y' = 3\). Collect \(y'\): \(y'(x^2+2y) = 3-2xy\). So \(y' = \frac{3-2xy}{x^2+2y}\).

questions.question: Find the equation of the normal line to the curve \(y = x^2 - 3x\) at the point \((3, 0)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=2x-3\). At \(x=3\), tangent slope \(=3\). Normal slope \(=-\frac{1}{3}\). Equation: \(y-0=-\frac{1}{3}(x-3)\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x) = \frac{x^2}{x+1}\). Find the instantaneous rate of change of \(f\) at \(x=2\).
If \(h(0) = 3\) and \(h(5) = 11\), find \(\int_0^5 h'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_0^5 h'(x)\,dx = h(5)-h(0) = 11-3 = 8\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=x^2-6x+8\) on \([1,5]\), find the value of \(c\) in \((1,5)\) guaranteed by the Mean Value Theorem.
Differentiate \(f(x) = \frac{x^2}{\ln x}\).
questions.explanation: Quotient rule: \(f'(x)=\frac{2x\cdot\ln x - x^2\cdot(1/x)}{(\ln x)^2}=\frac{2x\ln x - x}{(\ln x)^2}\). Note options A and C are equivalent since \(\frac{2x\ln x-x}{(\ln x)^2}=\frac{x(2\ln x-1)}{(\ln x)^2}\), so both simplify to the same expression. Option A is the unsimplified form.

questions.question: A particle has velocity \(v(t)=2t^2-8t+6\) ft/s on \([0,5]\). Find the minimum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the intervals on which \(f(x)=x^3-9x^2+24x-10\) is increasing.
Which of the following functions is NOT differentiable at \(x=0\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(x)=x^{1/3}\) has a vertical tangent at \(x=0\) since \(f'(x)=\frac{1}{3}x^{-2/3}\to\infty\) as \(x\to0\). Therefore it is not differentiable at \(x=0\). The other three functions are smooth and differentiable there.

questions.question: Sand is poured into a pile at a rate of \(r(t)=6t^2+4t\) cubic feet per minute. How many cubic feet are added from \(t=0\) to \(t=3\) minutes?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) changes from negative to positive at \(x=0\), from positive to negative at \(x=4\), and equals zero at \(x=6\) with \(f'\) negative on both sides of \(x=6\). Classify each critical point.
options: Min at 0, max at 4, neither at 6
Max at 0, min at 4, neither at 6
Min at 0, max at 4, min at 6
Max at 0, min at 4, max at 6
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: − to + ⇒ relative minimum at \(x=0\); + to − ⇒ relative maximum at \(x=4\); no sign change (negative on both sides) ⇒ neither a max nor min at \(x=6\).

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=\frac{1}{x}\) from \(x=1\) to \(x=e^3\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)<0\), \(f'(a)>0\), and \(f''(a)<0\). Which description best matches the behavior near \(x=a\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(a)<0\) means the function is below the x‑axis; \(f'(a)>0\) means it is increasing; \(f''(a)<0\) means it is concave down.

questions.question: Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=x^2-1\) and \(y=3\).
For \(f(x)=x^4-8x^2+3\), determine the interval(s) on which \(f\) is concave down.
Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=\ln(2x-1)\) at \(x=1\).
The radius of a circle is decreasing at a rate of 3 cm/s. At what rate is the area decreasing when the radius is 5 cm?
questions.explanation: \(A=\pi r^2\), so \(\frac{dA}{dt}=2\pi r\frac{dr}{dt}\). With \(r=5\) and \(\frac{dr}{dt}=-3\): \(\frac{dA}{dt}=2\pi(5)(-3)=-30\pi\) cm²/s. The area is decreasing at a rate of \(30\pi\) cm²/s.

questions.question: A population decays according to \(P(t)=800e^{-0.02t}\). How much remains after 50 years?
Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=x^4-8x^2+1\) using the First Derivative Test.
options: Relative maximum at \(x=0\); relative minima at \(x=\pm2\)
Relative minimum at \(x=0\); relative maxima at \(x=\pm2\)
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=4x^3-16x=4x(x-2)(x+2)\). Sign analysis: \(f'<0\) for \(x<-2\), \(f'>0\) for \(-2<x<0\), \(f'<0\) for \(0<x<2\), \(f'>0\) for \(x>2\). First Derivative Test: relative minimum at \(x=-2\) (–→+), relative maximum at \(x=0\) (+→–), relative minimum at \(x=2\) (–→+).

questions.question: Find the value of \(k\) that makes \(f(x) = \begin{cases} 2kx-1 & x \le 1 \\ 3x^2+k & x>1 \end{cases}\) continuous at \(x=1\).
Use the Trapezoidal Rule with \(n=4\) to approximate \(\int_0^2 e^{x/2}\,dx\).
Find the critical points of \(f(x)=2\sin x\cos x\) on \([0,\pi]\).
The base of a solid is bounded by \(y=2\sqrt{x}\) and \(y=0\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=4\). Cross sections perpendicular to the x‑axis are squares. Find the volume.
questions.explanation: Side length of each square cross section = \(2\sqrt{x}\). Cross-sectional area = \((2\sqrt{x})^2=4x\). Volume \(=\int_0^4 4x\,dx = 2x^2\big|_0^4=32\).

questions.question: At what x‑value(s) on the curve \(y=x^2\) is the tangent line parallel to \(y=6x-1\)?
Is \(f(x)=|x^2-4|\) differentiable at \(x=2\)?
options: No, because the left and right derivatives at \(x=2\) are not equal
Yes, because the function is continuous at \(x=2\)
No, because the function is not continuous at \(x=2\)
questions.explanation: For \(x\) near 2 from the left, \(f(x)=4-x^2\), so the left derivative at \(x=2\) is \(-2(2)=-4\). For \(x>2\), \(f(x)=x^2-4\), so the right derivative at \(x=2\) is \(2(2)=4\). Since \(-4\ne4\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=2\).

questions.question: Let \(H(x)=\int_0^{\sqrt{x}}\cos(t)\,dt\). Find \(H'(4)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC and chain rule: \(H'(x)=\cos(\sqrt{x})\cdot\frac{1}{2\sqrt{x}}\). At \(x=4\): \(H'(4)=\cos(2)\cdot\frac{1}{4}=\frac{\cos 2}{4}\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\lim_{x\to0}\frac{e^{2x}-1-2x}{x^2}\).
questions.explanation: The limit is \(\frac{0}{0}\) form. Apply L'Hôpital's Rule: \(\lim\frac{2e^{2x}-2}{2x}\). Still \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply again: \(\lim\frac{4e^{2x}}{2}=\frac{4}{2}=2\).

questions.question: A farmer fences a rectangular field alongside a river using 120 m of fencing (no fence along the river). What dimensions maximize the enclosed area?
questions.explanation: Let \(x\) = the two sides perpendicular to the river, \(y\) = side parallel to river. Constraint: \(2x+y=120\) ⇒ \(y=120-2x\). Area: \(A=xy=x(120-2x)=120x-2x^2\). \(A'=120-4x=0\) ⇒ \(x=30\), \(y=60\). Dimensions: 30 m \(\times\) 60 m.

questions.question: Use the Second Derivative Test to classify the critical points of \(f(x)=x^3-6x^2+9x+2\).
options: Relative maximum at \(x=1\), relative minimum at \(x=3\)
Relative minimum at \(x=1\), relative maximum at \(x=3\)
Relative maximum at \(x=3\), relative minimum at \(x=0\)

questions.question: Use a left Riemann sum with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^2(x^2+1)\,dx\).
Find \(\frac{d}{dx}[\arcsin(4x)]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=t^3-3t^2-9t+5\). Find the acceleration at the moment(s) when the velocity is zero.
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=x^3-3x\) on \([-2,3]\).
options: Absolute max 18 at \(x=3\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=1\) (and \(x=-2\))
Absolute max 2 at \(x=-1\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=1\)
Absolute max 18 at \(x=3\); absolute min \(-10\) at \(x=-2\)
Absolute max 2 at \(x=-1\); absolute min \(-10\) at \(x=-2\)

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{y}{x}\), \(y(1)=3\).
A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=\cos(\pi t)\) on \([0,2]\). Find the total distance traveled.
questions.explanation: \(\cos(\pi t)\) has period 2, and \(|v|\) is symmetric. Total distance \(=\int_0^2|\cos(\pi t)|\,dt=4\int_0^{1/2}\cos(\pi t)\,dt=4\left[\frac{\sin(\pi t)}{\pi}\right]_0^{1/2}=4\cdot\frac{1}{\pi}=\frac{4}{\pi}\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=(3x^2+7)^5\).
Use linear approximation at \(x=9\) to estimate \(\sqrt{9.06}\).
